lead_paragraph: Detroit Tigers catcher Iván Rodríguez was suspended yesterday for one game by Major League Baseball for his conduct during a game against the Seattle Mariners on Thursday.Rodríguez, who was also fined an undisclosed amount, was ejected from Thursday’s game in the fourth inning for arguing that he was interfered with while trying to throw out a base stealer.As Rodríguez, a 14-time All-Star, was trying to throw out Adrián Beltre at second base, the batter, Yuniesky Betancourt, was bent over and astride the plate. Rodríguez avoided making contact with Betancourt, but his throw sailed over second base and into center field for an error that allowed Beltre to advance to third.Rodríguez then began arguing with the plate umpire Mike Winters and at one point appeared to come close to bumping him — if not making contact.
